cards.name: Plague Wind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Ratcatcher
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Rat card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: An ogre's poisonous stench is like fine Kashkaval cheese to the noses lowest to the ground.
cards.originalText:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Rat card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ravenous Chupacabra
cards.text: When Ravenous Chupacabra enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Opening Orazca unleashed more horrors than just the Immortal Sun.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Chupacabra enters the battlefield, destroy target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Relentless Rats
cards.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

rulings.text: The second ability of Relentless Rats lets you ignore the "four-of" rule. It doesn't let you ignore format legality. For example, during a Masters 25 Limited event, you can't add Relentless Rats from your personal collection.

cards.originalText:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

cards.name: Returned Phalanx
cards.text:
Defender
{1}{U}: Returned Phalanx can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: They lived in different nations and fought in different eras, but as the Returned, they link arms as one.
cards.originalText:
Defender
{1}{U}: Returned Phalanx can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

cards.name: Ruthless Ripper
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Morph—Reveal a black card in your hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Ruthless Ripper is turned face up, target player loses 2 life.

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a converted mana cost of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It's colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it's turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn't cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren't affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can't look at face-down spells or permanents you don't control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You're not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
Morph—Reveal a black card in your hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Ruthless Ripper is turned face up, target player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Street Wraith
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Cycling—Pay 2 life. (Pay 2 life, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The lamps on Wyndmoor Street snuff themselves at midnight and refuse to relight, afraid to illuminate what lies in the darkness.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Swampwalk
Cycling—Pay 2 life. (Pay 2 life, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Supernatural Stamina
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control."
cards.flavor:
"All are not equal—neither in life nor after death. Bontu's favorites will stand highest in eternity."
—Senifet, vizier of Bontu

rulings.text: Supernatural Stamina's effect works only once. If the targeted creature dies and is then returned to the battlefield, it's considered to be a new creature. If that new creature dies, it won't come back a second time.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control."

cards.name: Triskaidekaphobia
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player gains 1 life.
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player loses 1 life.

rulings.text: You can choose a mode even if no player will lose the game. Players will still gain or lose life as appropriate.
If you choose Triskaidekaphobia's second mode and begin to resolve it while an opponent's life total is 13 and your life total is 1, that opponent will lose the game before you lose 1 life.
If each player has 13 life as Triskaidekaphobia's ability resolves, the game ends in a draw.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, each team with 13 life loses the game, then each player on each team gains or loses 1 life, causing the team's life total to go up or down by 2.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player gains 1 life.
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Undead Gladiator
cards.text:
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Return Undead Gladiator from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The Cabal loves encores.

rulings.text: The ability to return to your hand can only be activated while this card is in your graveyard.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Return Undead Gladiator from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Unearth
cards.text:
Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: No matter how deep you bury it, some evil refuses to stay dead.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Vampire Lacerator
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless an opponent has 10 or less life.
cards.flavor: The lacerators cut themselves before each hunt. They must feed before the sun rises or bleed to death.

rulings.text: Whether an opponent has 10 or less life is checked only as Vampire Lacerator's ability resolves.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless an opponent has 10 or less life.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"On dark nights you can still see the light of the Vess girl's lantern out in the Caligo, seeking her lost brother. Those who follow are doomed to join her endless search."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp.

cards.name: Zombify
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Zulaport Cutthroat
cards.text: Whenever Zulaport Cutthroat or another creature you control dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Eldrazi? Ha! Try walking through Zulaport at night with your pockets full. Now that's dangerous."

rulings.text: If Zulaport Cutthroat dies at the same time as another creature you control, its ability triggers for that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Zulaport Cutthroat's ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you to gain 1 life.

foreignNames.name: ズーラポートの殺し屋

cards.originalText: Whenever Zulaport Cutthroat or another creature you control dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

rulings.text: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Akroma, Angel of Fury
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white and from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: If Akroma, Angel of Fury is cast face down, it can be countered.
Akroma, Angel of Fury and Akroma, Angel of Wrath do not have the same name, so the legend rule does not apply.

In a Commander game where this card is your commander, you may cast it face-down from the Command zone by paying {3} plus {2} for each time it has been cast from your command zone. The cost to turn it face-up is unaffected.
The "legend rule" cares about legendary permanents with the exact same English name. You can control Akroma, Angel of Fury and Akroma, Angel of Wrath at the same time.

foreignNames.name: 憤怒の天使アクローマ

cards.originalText:
Akroma, Angel of Fury can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white and from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Balduvian Horde
cards.text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
cards.flavor:
"We earn no medals and fight for no titles. Blood is proof of our victory."
—Lovisa Coldeyes

rulings.text: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

foreignNames.name: バルデュヴィアの大軍

cards.originalText: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
cards.flavor: The most frightening storms are those not woven by nature's hand.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

foreignNames.name: ボール・ライトニング

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

rulings.text: If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply "as" a land enters the battlefield, such as the first ability of Cavern of Souls. This is a change from previous rulings.
Nonbasic lands will lose any other land types and abilities they had. They will gain the land type Mountain and gain the ability "{T}: Add {R}."
This effect doesn't affect names or supertypes. It won't turn any land into a basic land or remove the legendary supertype from a legendary land, and the lands won't be named "Mountain."
If a nonbasic land has an ability that triggers "when" it enters the battlefield, it will lose that ability before it triggers.

cards.originalText: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.name: Browbeat
cards.text: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to them. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept
cards.originalText: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Chandra's Outrage
cards.text: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Chandra never believed in using her "inside voice."

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Chandra's Outrage resolves, the spell doesn't resolve. No player is dealt damage.

cards.originalText: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Chartooth Cougar
cards.text:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Mountaincycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Mountain card. After you find a Mountain card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Mountaincycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Mountaincycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Mountaincycling from being activated.

Mountaincycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Mountaincycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Mountain land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Mountain card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Cinder Storm
cards.text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Any pyromancer can summon fire with a thought. The trick is putting it out.
cards.originalText: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Crimson Mage
cards.text: {R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor:
"We wield the fires of rage. War is our blood and destruction our birthright."
—Crimson creed
cards.originalText: {R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Eidolon of the Great Revel
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Eidolon of the Great Revel deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Xenagos reveled while Theros burned.

rulings.text: Casting Eidolon of the Great Revel doesn't cause its own ability to trigger. It must be on the battlefield when the spell is cast for its ability to trigger.
The amount of mana spent to cast a spell doesn't change its converted mana cost. For example, a card cast with its morph ability has a converted mana cost of 0 even though {3} was paid.
The converted mana cost of a spell with {X} in its mana cost includes the value chosen for X.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Eidolon of the Great Revel deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Enthralling Victor
cards.text: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

rulings.text: Once Enthralling Victor's ability resolves and you gain control of a creature, raising its power above 2 won't cause you to lose control of it. Similarly, it doesn't matter if Enthralling Victor leaves the battlefield or you lose control of Enthralling Victor. You'll keep control of the creature that was the target of the ability until the end of the turn.
Enthralling Victor's ability can target a creature that's already untapped. You'll still gain control of it and it will gain haste.

cards.originalText: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Fortune Thief
cards.text:
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
Morph {R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: Fortune Thief's effect applies only if your life total is being reduced by damage. Other effects or costs (such as losing or paying life) can reduce your life total below 1 as normal.
Fortune Thief's effect is not a prevention effect. It stops unpreventable damage from reducing your life total below 1.
Fortune Thief doesn't change how much damage is dealt; it just changes how much life that damage makes you lose. Abilities such as lifelink will see the full amount of damage being dealt.
Fortune Thief won't prevent you from losing the game if your life total becomes 0 or less or if some other effect causes you to lose the game.
If your life total is less than 1 but you've somehow avoided losing the game, Fortune Thief's effect won't apply at all if you're dealt damage.

cards.originalText:
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
Morph {R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Frenzied Goblin
cards.text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

rulings.text: Frenzied Goblin's ability has only one target. You can't pay {R} multiple times to stop multiple creatures from blocking.

cards.originalText: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Genju of the Spires
cards.text:
Enchant Mountain
{2}: Enchanted Mountain becomes a 6/1 red Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Mountain is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Spires from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Enchant Mountain
{2}: Enchanted Mountain becomes a 6/1 red Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Mountain is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Spires from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Goblin War Drums
cards.text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: Their eardrums may have given out, but the rest of them never will.

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature," none of your creatures can be blocked.
Multiple War Drums are not cumulative. They are redundant.

foreignNames.name: ゴブリン・ウォー・ドラム

cards.originalText: Creatures you control have menace.

cards.name: Hordeling Outburst
cards.text: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"Leave no scraps, lest you attract pests."
—Mardu threat
cards.originalText: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

cards.name: Humble Defector
cards.text: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor:
"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

rulings.text: Humble Defector's ability can be activated any time during your turn, including in response to a spell or ability.

If Humble Defector isn't on the battlefield as its ability resolves, but the target player is still a legal target, the ability will resolve. You'll draw two cards, even though the player won't gain control of Humble Defector.

If Humble Defector is controlled by a player other than its owner, and its controller leaves the game, the effect giving that player control of Humble Defector ends. Humble Defector will return to the control of the player still in the game who most recently controlled it.
If Humble Defector's owner leaves the game, Humble Defector not-so-humbly leaves the game along with that player.

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Imperial Recruiter
cards.text: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: A passionate recruiter will win a war before the first arrow flies.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

cards.originalText: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ire Shaman
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Megamorph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Ire Shaman is turned face up, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

rulings.text: If a face-down Ire Shaman attacks and is blocked by one creature, turning it face up won't cause it to become unblocked.
The card exiled with Ire Shaman's last ability is exiled face up.

Playing the card exiled with Ire Shaman's last ability follows the normal rules for playing the card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all applicable timing rules. For example, if the card is a creature card, you can cast that card only during your main phase while the stack is empty.
Under normal circumstances, you can play a land card exiled with Ire Shaman only if you haven't played a land yet that turn.
If you don't play the card, it will remain exiled.
Turning a face-down creature with megamorph face up and putting a +1/+1 counter on it is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

If a face-down creature with megamorph is turned face up some other way (for example, if you manifest a card with megamorph and then pay its mana cost to turn it face up), you won't put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Megamorph is a variant of the morph ability. You can find more information on morph on cards with morph from the Khans of Tarkir set.

cards.originalText:
Menace
Megamorph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Ire Shaman is turned face up, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

cards.name: Izzet Chemister
cards.text:
Haste
{R}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard.
{1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Izzet Chemister: Cast any number of cards exiled with Izzet Chemister without paying their mana costs.

rulings.text: The last ability of Izzet Chemister only lets you cast cards exiled by that card. If Izzet Chemister leaves the battlefield before you activate that ability, the exiled cards are lost forever.

If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Tormenting Voice, those must be paid to cast the card.
If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

You must cast any of the exiled cards you wish to cast while Izzet Chemister's last ability is resolving. You can't cast them later in the turn. A sorcery cast this way will be cast at a time you normally wouldn't be able to.
You cast the exiled cards one at a time in any order. Later spells can target ones you cast earlier. None of the spells resolve until after you're done casting them all.
Any of the cards you don't cast will remain exiled.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{R}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard.
{1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Izzet Chemister: Cast any number of cards exiled with Izzet Chemister without paying their mana costs.

cards.name: Jackal Pup
cards.text: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
cards.flavor: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.
cards.originalText: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.

cards.name: Kindle
cards.text: Kindle deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

rulings.text: Because Kindle is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn't in your graveyard and won't add to the amount of damage dealt.

cards.originalText: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
cards.originalText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Magus of the Wheel
cards.text: {1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Wheel: Each player discards their hand, then draws seven cards.
cards.flavor: "Fate is not as fixed as you might think."

rulings.text: If each player has fewer than seven cards in their library as Magus of the Wheel's ability resolves, the game ends in a draw.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Wheel: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.

cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don't have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

cards.originalText: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The embers of our homes still smolder, and already the villages of Kjeldor burn in retaliation. What they have started, we will finish."
—Lovisa Coldeyes
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pyre Hound
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Pyre Hound.
cards.flavor: Its growl is the crackling and popping of a wildfire untamed.

rulings.text: Pyre Hound's triggered ability resolves before the spell that causes it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Pyre Hound.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Red Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.
cards.flavor: Nothing restrains a burning passion.
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.

cards.name: Simian Spirit Guide
cards.text: Exile Simian Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"It's rarely worth questioning where the mana comes from. Just be grateful."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Elvish Spirit Guide.
This ability is a mana ability.

cards.originalText: Exile Simian Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skeletonize
cards.text: Skeletonize deals 3 damage to target creature. When a creature dealt damage this way dies this turn, create a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token with "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
cards.flavor: Fire burns away both flesh and freedom.

rulings.text: You get the token created by Skeletonize's delayed triggered ability regardless of who controlled the creature.

cards.originalText: Skeletonize deals 3 damage to target creature. When a creature dealt damage this way dies this turn, create a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token with "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.name: Skirk Commando
cards.text:
Whenever Skirk Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Skirk Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Soulbright Flamekin
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, you may add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: When provoked, a flamekin's inner fire burns far hotter than any giant's forge.

rulings.text: You add eight red mana only the third time Soulbright Flamekin's ability resolves in a turn. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times in that same turn.

When Soulbright Flamekin's ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that same creature has already resolved that turn. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
Soulbright Flamekin's ability uses the stack and can be responded to. Because it has a target, it's not a mana ability, even if you know that it will produce mana.

cards.originalText: {2}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, you may add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Spikeshot Goblin
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Proximity discouraged. Do not approach."
—Vulshok field guide

rulings.text: Spikeshot Goblin's power is determined as its ability resolves. If Spikeshot Goblin has left the battlefield, use its power as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Thresher Lizard
cards.text: Thresher Lizard gets +1/+2 as long as you have one or fewer cards in hand.
cards.flavor: The sound of its plated tail beating on desert rocks is often mistaken for the footfalls of a much larger predator.

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Thresher Lizard while you have one or fewer cards in hand may become lethal if cards are put into your hand during that turn.

cards.originalText: Thresher Lizard gets +1/+2 as long as you have one or fewer cards in hand.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Uncaged Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor:
"It's right to fear those that you keep locked away."
—Rahilda, Vildin-Pack alpha
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
cards.flavor: "A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."

rulings.text: Zada's ability triggers whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada and no other object or player.

If you cast an instant or sorcery spell that has multiple targets, but it's targeting only Zada with all of them, Zada's ability will trigger. The copies will similarly each be targeting only one of your other creatures. You can't change any of the copy's targets to other creatures.
Any creature you control that couldn't be targeted by the original spell (due to shroud, protection abilities, targeting restrictions, or any other reason) is just ignored by Zada's ability.
You control all the copies. You choose the order the copies are put onto the stack. The original spell will be on the stack beneath those copies and will resolve last.
The copies that the ability creates are created on the stack, so they're not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell (like Zada's ability itself) won't trigger.
If the spell that's copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copies will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell that's copied has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Rolling Thunder does), the copies have the same value of X.

The controller of a copy can't choose to pay any alternative or additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any alternative or additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.

cards.name: Ainok Survivalist
cards.text:
Megamorph {1}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Ainok Survivalist is turned face up, destroy target artifact or enchantment an opponent controls.

rulings.text: Turning a face-down creature with megamorph face up and putting a +1/+1 counter on it is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

If a face-down creature with megamorph is turned face up some other way (for example, if you manifest a card with megamorph and then pay its mana cost to turn it face up), you won't put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Megamorph is a variant of the morph ability. You can find more information on morph on cards with morph from the Khans of Tarkir set.

cards.originalText:
Megamorph {1}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Ainok Survivalist is turned face up, destroy target artifact or enchantment an opponent controls.

cards.name: Ambassador Oak
cards.text: When Ambassador Oak enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: Treefolk and elves share a common interest in the forests, but really the elves just feel at home with the view from above.
cards.originalText: When Ambassador Oak enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

cards.name: Ancient Stirrings
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a colorless card from among them and put it into your hand. Then put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. (Cards with no colored mana in their mana costs are colorless. Lands are also colorless.)
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a colorless card from among them and put it into your hand. Then put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Arbor Elf
cards.text: {T}: Untap target Forest.
cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target Forest.

cards.name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
cards.text: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home."

rulings.text: Azusa's ability is cumulative with other effects that allow you to play additional lands, such as that of Wayward Swordtooth (from the Rivals of Ixalan set).

cards.originalText: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.

cards.name: Broodhatch Nantuko
cards.text:
Whenever Broodhatch Nantuko is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
Morph {2}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: You can choose to put zero tokens or all the tokens onto the battlefield. You can't choose a number in between.

foreignNames.name: 大群を産むナントゥーコ

cards.originalText:
Whenever Broodhatch Nantuko is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
Morph {2}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Colossal Dreadmaw
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Courser of Kruphix
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library if it's a land card.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: While playing with the top card of your library revealed, if you draw multiple cards, reveal each one before you draw it. If you put multiple cards on top of your library at once, reveal only the one new top card.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, you don't reveal the new top card until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
Courser of Kruphix doesn't change when you can play lands. You can do so only during your main phase when you have priority and the stack is empty.

Playing a land from the top of your library counts as your land play for the turn. Once you play a land during your turn, you won't be able to play an additional land from the top of your library unless another effect (such as that of Azusa, Lost but Seeking) allows you to.

foreignNames.name: クルフィックスの狩猟者

cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library if it's a land card.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Cultivate
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.

rulings.text: If you choose to find only one basic land card, you put it onto the battlefield tapped.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Echoing Courage
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.

rulings.text: Echoing Courage has only one target. Other creatures with that name are not targeted. For example, a creature with protection from green will still get +2/+2 if it has the same name as the target creature.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Echoing Courage tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. No creatures get +2/+2.

The name of a creature token is the same as the creature types it was created with, unless the token is a copy of another creature or the effect that created the token specifically gave it a different name. For example, a 1/1 Cat Soldier creature token is named "Cat Soldier."
A face-down creature has no name, so it can't share a name with anything. This includes other creatures with no name.

cards.originalText: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Ember Weaver
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As long as you control a red permanent, Ember Weaver gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
cards.flavor:
"Each night, the sun unravels and blows away. Each day, the spiders set a new one in the sky."
—Sunseeder myth

rulings.text: As long as at least one permanent you control is the specified color, the ability will "work" and grant this creature the bonus. Otherwise, it won't have the bonus.

Whether Ember Weaver has first strike matters only at the point that the normal combat damage step would begin, and only if there hasn't already been a first-strike combat damage step that turn. If any of your creatures has first strike at that point, a first-strike combat damage step is created. -- If Ember Weaver has first strike at that point, it will assign and deal combat damage during that step (even if it loses first strike before that damage is dealt) and it won't deal combat damage during the normal combat damage step. -- If Ember Weaver doesn't have first strike at that point, it will assign and deal its combat damage during the normal combat damage step (even if it gains first strike before then).

cards.originalText:
Reach
As long as you control a red permanent, Ember Weaver gets +1/+0 and has first strike.

cards.name: Epic Confrontation
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: No matter the timeline, some legends will endure.

rulings.text: You can't cast Epic Confrontation unless you choose both a creature you control and a creature you don't control as targets.

If the creature you control is an illegal target as Epic Confrontation tries to resolve, the creature you control won't get +1/+2. If that creature is a legal target but the creature you don't control isn't, your creature will still get +1/+2. In both cases, neither creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Fierce Empath
cards.text: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Only the most effective tactics stand the test of time."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Invigorate
cards.text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay this spell's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Invigorate to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

If an effect says that an opponent can't gain life, you can't have that player gain life to pay Invigorate's alternative cost. If an effect instead replaces life gain, such as that of Sulfuric Vortex, you may choose to pay the cost even though the cost's action is replaced with nothing.

cards.originalText:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay Invigorate's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Iwamori of the Open Fist
cards.text:
Trample
When Iwamori of the Open Fist enters the battlefield, each opponent may put a legendary creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: When Iwamori's triggered ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is (if that player is an opponent) may choose a legendary creature card in hand without revealing it, then each other opponent in turn order may do the same, then all chosen cards are put onto the battlefield at the same time.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Iwamori of the Open Fist enters the battlefield, each opponent may put a legendary creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Kavu Climber
cards.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
The kavu might be above you
—Llanowar expression meaning
"keep an open mind"
cards.originalText: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Kavu Predator
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.
cards.flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

rulings.text: Kavu Predator's last ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Kor Firewalker or 6 life from Renewed Faith.

Each creature with lifelink dealing combat damage is a single life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures an opponent controls with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, Kavu Predator's ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature an opponent controls with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
If an opponent gains an amount of life "for each" of something (such as from Congregate), that life is gained as one event and Kavu Predator's ability triggers only once.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.

cards.name: Krosan Colossus
cards.text: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.
cards.originalText: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Krosan Tusker
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. (Do this before you draw.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. (Do this before you draw.)

cards.name: Living Wish
cards.text: You may choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.
cards.flavor: The best wishes include the will to tame their consequences.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.originalText: You may choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.

cards.name: Lull
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The clamor of war ceased as both armies stood and marveled at the beauty of Gaea's work.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Master of the Wild Hunt
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
{T}: Tap all untapped Wolf creatures you control. Each Wolf tapped this way deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power divided as its controller chooses among any number of those Wolves.

rulings.text: All Wolves you control are tapped as part of the activated ability's effect, not as a cost. Players may respond by attempting to tap or untap Wolves, or to create or remove them.

If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Master of the Wild Hunt's ability tries to resolve, the ability doesn't resolve. You won't tap your Wolves, and nothing will deal or be dealt damage.
Only a Wolf creature tapped as part of the ability's effect can be dealt damage by the target creature.

The controller of the target creature doesn't divide that creature's damage as the ability is activated (since the Wolves that will receive that damage aren't targeted), so that player does so as the ability resolves. There is no time to react between the time a Wolf is chosen, the time damage is dealt to it, and the time it's destroyed for having been dealt lethal damage. If you want to put a regeneration shield on one of those Wolves, or target it with a damage-prevention spell, or anything else, you must do so before the ability resolves (and before you know which Wolves will be chosen and how much damage will be dealt to them).

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
{T}: Tap all untapped Wolf creatures you control. Each Wolf tapped this way deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power divided as its controller chooses among any number of those Wolves.

cards.name: Nettle Sentinel
cards.text:
Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may untap Nettle Sentinel.
cards.flavor: Though Shadowmoor's monster-haunted wilds beckon, she never leaves her post.

rulings.text: Nettle Sentinel's triggered ability resolves before the spell that causes it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may untap Nettle Sentinel.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Presence of Gond
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token."
cards.flavor: "Here lies Gond, hero of Safehold Taldwen. May he ever guide our quest."

rulings.text: The creature's controller, not Presence of Gond's controller, is the one who can activate the ability, so that's the player who will get the token.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token."

cards.name: Protean Hulk
cards.text: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Meat and eggs. We eat!"
—Borborygmos

rulings.text: If a card in your library has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

You can find any number of creature cards, so long as their total converted mana cost is 6 or less. For example, you could find eight creature cards with converted mana cost 0 and three with converted mana cost 2, but you couldn't find two with converted mana cost 4.

cards.originalText: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rancor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.

rulings.text: If the creature this Aura would enchant is an illegal target by the time Rancor tries to resolve, the Aura spell doesn't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield, so it won't be put into a graveyard from the battlefield and its ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Stampede Driver
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The thunder of hooves is music to my ears."

rulings.text: Stampede Driver's ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+1 or gain trample.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Summoner's Pact
cards.text:
Search your library for a green creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {2}{G}{G}. If you don't, you lose the game.

rulings.text: Although originally printed with a characteristic-defining ability that defined its color, this card now has a color indicator. This color indicator can't be affected by text-changing effects (such as the one created by Crystal Spray), although color-changing effects can still overwrite it.

cards.originalText:
Search your library for a green creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {2}{G}{G}. If you don't, you lose the game.

cards.name: Timberpack Wolf
cards.text: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.
cards.flavor:
"The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Timberpack Wolf may become lethal if other Timberpack Wolves leave the battlefield during that turn.

cards.originalText: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.

cards.name: Tree of Redemption
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.
cards.flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

rulings.text: If Tree of Redemption isn't on the battlefield when its activated ability resolves, the exchange can't happen and the ability will have no effect.

When its activated ability resolves, Tree of Redemption's toughness will become your former life total and you will gain or lose an amount of life necessary so that your life total equals Tree of Redemption's former toughness. Other effects that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.

Any toughness-modifying effects, counters, Auras, or Equipment will apply after its toughness is set to your former life total. For example, say Tree of Redemption is enchanted with Lunarch Mantle (which makes it 2/15) and your life total is 7. After the exchange, Tree of Redemption would be a 2/9 creature (its toughness became 7, which was then modified by Lunarch Mantle) and your life total would be 15.

cards.originalText:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.

cards.name: Utopia Sprawl
cards.text:
Enchant Forest
As Utopia Sprawl enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever enchanted Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Enchant Forest
As Utopia Sprawl enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever enchanted Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of the chosen color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Vessel of Nascency
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Vessel of Nascency: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Vessel of Nascency: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Wildheart Invoker
cards.text: {8}: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Life as we know it dangles on the brink of extinction. We must show the strength they would steal from us."
—The Invokers' Tales
cards.originalText: {8}: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Woolly Loxodon
cards.text: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Even among the hardiest warriors of the Temur, loxodons are respected for their adaptation to the mountain snows.

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a converted mana cost of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It's colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it's turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn't cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren't affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can't look at face-down spells or permanents you don't control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You're not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

cards.originalText: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Animar, Soul of Elements
cards.text:
Protection from white and from black
Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Animar, Soul of Elements.
Creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Animar.

rulings.text: Animar's triggered ability triggers only when a creature spell is cast, after costs are paid. The counter put on Animar for a creature spell won't affect the cost of that creature spell, only future ones.
Animar's triggered ability resolves before the creature spell that causes it to trigger. The ability will resolve even if that spell is countered.

To determine the total cost of a creature spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the creature remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

cards.originalText:
Protection from white and from black
Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Animar, Soul of Elements.
Creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Animar.

cards.name: Baloth Null
cards.text: When Baloth Null enters the battlefield, return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Humans use pigs to hunt for mushrooms, don't they? It's like that."
—Harak, Malakir bloodwitch
cards.originalText: When Baloth Null enters the battlefield, return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Blightning
cards.text: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. That player or that planeswalker's controller discards two cards.
cards.flavor: While the smell of burning flesh is common in Grixis, the odor of smoldering brain matter is a rare treat.

rulings.text: The targeted player will discard two cards even if some or all of Blightning's damage is prevented or redirected.

cards.originalText: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player. That player discards two cards.

cards.name: Boros Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Boros Charm deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Permanents you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
• Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

rulings.text: If you choose the second mode, permanents that come under your control later in the turn will not have indestructible.

Planeswalkers with indestructible will still have loyalty counters removed from them as they are dealt damage. If planeswalker with indestructible has no loyalty counters, it will still be put into its owner's graveyard, as the rule that does this doesn't destroy the planeswalker.

cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Boros Charm deals 4 damage to target player.
• Permanents you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
• Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Brion Stoutarm
cards.text:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Boggarts and disturbing bits of boggarts flew through the air with alarming and untidy regularity.

rulings.text: If Brion Stoutarm leaves the battlefield after its ability has been activated but before it resolves, the game uses its last known information to determine that it had lifelink and you'll gain life for the damage it deals.

cards.originalText:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player.

cards.name: Cloudblazer
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudblazer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life and draw two cards.
cards.flavor: All the aether charts in the world can't compete with the trained eye of a talented scout.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cloudblazer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life and draw two cards.
